TABLE.NAME: paymentgateway_paypal
TABLE.COMMENT: Contains info about all transactions that have been made.

FIELD.NAME: txn_type
FIELD.COMMENT: The kind of transaction for which the IPN message was sent.

FIELD.NAME: business
FIELD.COMMENT: Email address or account ID of the payment recipient (that is, the merchant). Equivalent to the values of receiver_email (if payment is sent to primary account) and business set in the Website Payment HTML.

FIELD.NAME: parent_txn_id
FIELD.COMMENT: In the case of a refund, reversal, or canceled reversal, this variable contains the txn_id of the original transaction, while txn_id contains a new ID for the new transaction.

FIELD.NAME: receipt_id
FIELD.COMMENT: Unique ID generated during guest checkout (payment by credit card without logging in).

FIELD.NAME: receiver_email
FIELD.COMMENT: Primary email address of the payment recipient (that is, the merchant). If the payment is sent to a non-primary email address on your PayPal account, the receiver_email is still your primary email.

FIELD.NAME: receiver_id
FIELD.COMMENT: Unique account ID of the payment recipient (i.e., the merchant). This is the same as the recipient's referral ID.

FIELD.NAME: resend
FIELD.COMMENT: Whether this IPN message was resent (equals true); otherwise, this is the original message.

FIELD.NAME: residence_country
FIELD.COMMENT: ISO 3166 country code associated with the country of residence

FIELD.NAME: test_ipn
FIELD.COMMENT: Whether the message is a test message.

FIELD.NAME: txn_id
FIELD.COMMENT: The merchant's original transaction identification number for the payment from the buyer, against which the case was registered.

FIELD.NAME: item_name
FIELD.COMMENT: Item name as passed by you, the merchant. Or, if not passed by you, as entered by your customer.

FIELD.NAME: mc_currency
FIELD.COMMENT: For payment IPN notifications, this is the currency of the payment.

FIELD.NAME: mc_gross
FIELD.COMMENT: Full amount of the customer's payment, before transaction fee is subtracted. If this amount is negative, it signifies a refund or reversal, and either of those payment statuses can be for the full or partial amount of the original transaction.

FIELD.NAME: payment_date
FIELD.COMMENT: The PayPal-generated time and date stamp in the format HH:MM:SS Mmm DD, YYYY PDT

FIELD.NAME: courseid
FIELD.COMMENT: The ID for the course that the user tried to enrol in.

FIELD.NAME: userid
FIELD.COMMENT: The ID for the user that tried to enrol in a course.
